content:
• Friday, December 2, 2011
  • VZ

    Also affected by Verizon's (NYSE:VZ) deal with the cable giants: Dish Network (DISH +6.6%) and...

    Also affected by Verizon's (NYSE:VZ) deal with the cable giants: Dish Network (DISH +6.6%) and DirecTV (DTV -2.2%). Dish rose due to the value of its spectrum assets, which a Wells Fargo analyst pegs at $10B, based on the deal's price tag. DirecTV, which recently extended its reseller agreement with AT&T (NYSE:T), likely fell due to the prospect of additional competition, courtesy of Verizon's sales force. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S -3.7%) and Clearwire (CLWR +5.4%) head in opposite directions following Verizon...

    Sprint (S -3.7%) and Clearwire (CLWR +5.4%) head in opposite directions following Verizon (NYSE:VZ), Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), and Time Warner's (TWC) big spectrum/reseller deal (I, II, III). Though nominally bad for both firms, the deal's implications for the value of Clearwire's spectrum is giving it a lift. SR Capital believes Verizon's purchase price translates into an enterprise value of $31/share for Clearwire's spectrum.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • ENSG

    Shares of Ensign Group (ENSG +1.4%) are up today following the company's announcement that it...

    Shares of Ensign Group (ENSG +1.4%) are up today following the company's announcement that it has acquired Homecare Solutions, a small home health agency based in Denver, Colorado, through one of its subsidiaries.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • STJ

    Medical device names also are dropping, apparently in tandem with healthcare service firms: STJ...

    Medical device names also are dropping, apparently in tandem with healthcare service firms: STJ -7%, SYK -4.2%, MDT -6.1%, EW -2.8%, BSX -6.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM

  • Health care service companies are taking a hit today on reports that Medicare carriers in 11...

    Health care service companies are taking a hit today on reports that Medicare carriers in 11 states will begin performing 100% pre-payment audits on inpatient stays related to 15 cardiovascular and orthopedic treatments. There will be a 30-60 day period in which records will be reviewed to determine whether there was actually a medical necessity for the procedures that occurred during the hospital stay. THC -10%, HMA -8%, CYH -5.2%, HCA -7.4%, VHS -5.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBUX

    Teavana (TEA -10.4%) sells off even further (previous) after its CEO sounds warning bells about...

    Teavana (TEA -10.4%) sells off even further (previous) after its CEO sounds warning bells about its gross margin and lack of traffic on an earnings CC. That astonishingly light $36K sitting in the firm's coffers also continues to gnaw at investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • LOW

    Lowe's (LOW +1.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Goldman, citing management's efforts...

    Lowe's (LOW +1.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Goldman, citing management's efforts to improve store presentation, upgrade technology and overhaul and enhance marketing strategies. Additionally, for those who might be a bit gun-shy or risk averse in this volatile market, Goldman suggests possibly hedging your long position in Lowes against a short position in Home Depot (HD +1.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • SON

    Sonoco Products (SON +0.9%) gives an upbeat sales forecast for next year, easily exceeding...

    Sonoco Products (SON +0.9%) gives an upbeat sales forecast for next year, easily exceeding analyst forecasts on higher demand and a boost from its recently completed acquisition of protective-packaging provider Tegrant Corp. The company expects sales to grow to roughly $5B in 2012, well ahead of analysts' estimates for $4.6B, while FY12 earnings are anticipated to be in the range of $2.47 - $ 2.57 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • CALL

    magicJack VocalTec (CALL +3.4%), inventor of the magicJack voice over IP, gains after its Board...

    magicJack VocalTec (CALL +3.4%), inventor of the magicJack voice over IP, gains after its Board approves a two-for-one stock split to be paid in the form of a 100% stock dividend on December 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYN

    Microcap biotech developer Adeona Pharmaceuticals (AEN) continues to rally today, up another 19%...

    Microcap biotech developer Adeona Pharmaceuticals (AEN) continues to rally today, up another 19% after reporting positive Phase I/II results on Wednesday for its clinical collaborator for Lou Gehrig's disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo (WFC +2.5%) says it expects another year of slow economic growth and pressured...

    Wells Fargo (WFC +2.5%) says it expects another year of slow economic growth and pressured profit margins, but it will ask regulators to allow it to increase its dividend and buy back more stock. The confidence illustrates how firmly executives believe they can increase revenue even in the weak economy by selling more products and taking customers away from competitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC +5.7%) gets a bump higher after being upgraded to Buy on valuation at BofA...

    HollyFrontier (HFC +5.7%) gets a bump higher after being upgraded to Buy on valuation at BofA Merrill Lynch, citing improving industry fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • WNR

    Western Refining (WNR +6.1%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform by Credit Suisse on...

    Western Refining (WNR +6.1%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Outperform by Credit Suisse on valuation. The firm says the refiner has sold off considerably since the Seaway pipeline reversal announcement and on weak Q4 margins, and it's overdone. The company has reduced debt, culled unprofitable ventures and improved cash flow recently, which should equate to higher multiples over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • DYN

    Shares of Dynegy (DYN +9.9%) move higher after the companys says its joined its Dynegy Holdings...

    Shares of Dynegy (DYN +9.9%) move higher after the companys says its joined its Dynegy Holdings unit in filing a proposed reorganization plan with the U.S. bankruptcy court. Additionally, the company has appointed a new chairman. Current chairman E. Hunter Harrison will resign as of December 16, and be replaced by independent director Thomas Elward, both of whom joined the board in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • VZ

    "A complete reordering of the competitive universe as we know it," writes Bernstein's Craig...

    "A complete reordering of the competitive universe as we know it," writes Bernstein's Craig Moffett of the Verizon (NYSE:VZ) deal to purchase Spectrum. The joint marketing effort between the cable companies (CMCSA, TWX) and Verizon "amounts to a partnership between formerly mortal enemies ... a strategic masterstroke for Verizon." The best deal in town is about to be a bundle of Comcast's broadband, voice, and video combined with Verizon mobile.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • SUSS

    Susser Holdings (SUSS -2.5%) trades lower after pricing its public offering of 3.5 million...

    Susser Holdings (SUSS -2.5%) trades lower after pricing its public offering of 3.5 million shares at $21.75 per share. The company plans to use the net proceeds primarily for new store development and opportunistic debt reduction.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -3.1%) fall off after the firms reports in-line earnings and steers...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -3.1%) fall off after the firms reports in-line earnings and steers guidance for FY11 sales to a range of $162M-$166M and comparable stores sales to the mid-single digits. The firm's light cash position of $36K is drawing more than a few comments on Twitter from followers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • EXEL

    Exelixis (EXEL -5.7%) takes a hit on a Lazard downgrade to Neutral. The firm says it has...

    Exelixis (EXEL -5.7%) takes a hit on a Lazard downgrade to Neutral. The firm says it has concerns over certain clinical and regulatory risks associated with the drug developer's 306 pain trial after presentations at its R&D day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLS

    Celestica (CLS -3.5%) dips after Ticonderoga cuts the shares to sell on the back of its...

    Celestica (CLS -3.5%) dips after Ticonderoga cuts the shares to sell on the back of its disappointing October quarter results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • ALL

    Allstate (ALL +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Deutsche Bank, as the bar is now "exceeding low" for...

    Allstate (ALL +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Deutsche Bank, as the bar is now "exceeding low" for gains after four years of disappointment. Allstate's expected 8% return on equity isn't much lower than peers trading at a significant premium to ALL and whose earnings outlooks are meaningfully at risk, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • NPO

    Industrial sealant manufacturer EnPro Industries (NPO +6%) trades higher after KeyBanc initiates...

    Industrial sealant manufacturer EnPro Industries (NPO +6%) trades higher after KeyBanc initiates coverage of the shares with a Buy on valuation and a $42 price target. KeyBanc says the shares are attractively valued right now, and poised to gain from a settlement plan and permanent resolution of its asbestos liability problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP +5.4%) clocks a gain a day after announcing it completed its...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP +5.4%) clocks a gain a day after announcing it completed its submission to the FDA for its experimental Gattex drug - a hopeful sign which follows the firm reporting "adverse events" in October with trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +2.9%) moves up after its FQ1 misses its EPS projections but beats on...

    Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +2.9%) moves up after its FQ1 misses its EPS projections but beats on revenues, as charges weighed down its bottom line. Same-store sales rose 4% on better overall net sales, boosted by a 9.8% sales jump in its Justice preteen business, but margins narrowed to 42.3% from 42.7% on a jump in overhead expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +10.3%) recovers much of yesterday's drubbing after Maxim Group...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +10.3%) recovers much of yesterday's drubbing after Maxim Group initiates the shares with a Buy, saying that with over 5M subscribers, the Nook is turning the company into an attractive online retailer with a subscriber-driven model.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • MON

    Nature wins again: The EPA finds (.pdf) that Monsanto's (MON -2.8%) genetically-altered corn may...

    Nature wins again: The EPA finds (.pdf) that Monsanto's (MON -2.8%) genetically-altered corn may be losing its potency to kill rootworms in four Midwest states. "Resistance is suspected in at least some portions of four states in which 'unexpected damage' reports originated."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 9 Comments
  • CASC-OLD

    Shares of Cascade Corp. (CASC-OLD +12.6%) jump after its Q3 tops estimates, as the company's...

    Shares of Cascade Corp. (CASC-OLD +12.6%) jump after its Q3 tops estimates, as the company's efforts to streamline its operations begin to pay off. Earnings more than doubled on a 29% Y/Y jump in sales, as the forklift-parts company racked up better shipment volumes due to improving economic conditions and a strong global lift truck market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • HSP

    Speculation that Hospira (HSP -2.3%) shares have become so cheap in the face of scrutiny for...

    Speculation that Hospira (HSP -2.3%) shares have become so cheap in the face of scrutiny for flaws in its manufacturing practices that the company may become a takeover target isn't helping the stock today. A potential FDA consent decree over alleged safety violations at one plant would slow production and perhaps even lead to a complete shutdown of the facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • PVH

    Apparel brand owner PVH is now up 6.6% following its FQ3 beat.  Brean Murray (Buy) is...

    Apparel brand owner PVH is now up 6.6% following its FQ3 beat. Brean Murray (Buy) is impressed with the strong performance of PVH's Tommy Hillfiger and Calvin Klein brands, while Citi (Buy) is pleased with management's CC comments about potential upside to FQ4 guidance, if current business trends continue. Rising in sympathy: RL +2%. PERY +4.5%. LIZ +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +10.6%) soar, taking back some ground lost following its lackluster...

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY +10.6%) soar, taking back some ground lost following its lackluster presentation at the Baird tech conference and shrugging off a bearish call from Jim Cramer on his lightning round.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • QRVO

    Triquint Semiconductor (TQNT +3.7%) trades up after SEC filings show a number of its directors...

    Triquint Semiconductor (TQNT +3.7%) trades up after SEC filings show a number of its directors buying shares of the company earlier this week. (I, II, III).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • EDMC

    Education Management (EDMC +4.8%) gets a lift when Barrington Research reiterates an Outperform...

    Education Management (EDMC +4.8%) gets a lift when Barrington Research reiterates an Outperform rating on shares. Analysts say they're "increasingly confident" that the worst is over from a regulatory and growth standpoint for the education firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • MS

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.1%) are enjoying a rocket-fueled boost this morning from the U.S....

    Financial stocks (XLF +2.1%) are enjoying a rocket-fueled boost this morning from the U.S. jobs report and Merkel's speech predicting progress in Europe. Morgan Stanley (MS +8.7%), perceived to have the most exposure to European debt problems, soars to second place among S&P gainers. Also: BAC +4.2%, JPM +6.8%, C +5.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • MITL

    Shares of Mitel Networks (MITL +27%) soar in a post-earnings relief rally and a flurry of...

    Shares of Mitel Networks (MITL +27%) soar in a post-earnings relief rally and a flurry of short-covering - having lost 56% of its value over the past year - after its FQ2 easily beat estimates. Special charges and the acceleration of planned restructuring costs masked a 4.8% Y/Y increase in revenue growth, as its bottom line benefited from cost cutting and a jump in gross margins to 49.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • DIS

    Disney (DIS +1.9%) is outperforming today, and a positive Barron's mention could be playing a...

    Disney (DIS +1.9%) is outperforming today, and a positive Barron's mention could be playing a role. The paper thinks Disney's recent dividend hike could be a sign of things to come, given its strong cash flow, and believes its current share price doesn't appear to "fully reflect the good news."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • FTK

    Flotek Industries (FTK +9%) jumps after Global Hunter initiates coverage of the shares with a...

    Flotek Industries (FTK +9%) jumps after Global Hunter initiates coverage of the shares with a Buy, calling the stock "overlooked, undervalued, and under-appreciated." The firm says the oilfield services company generates solid free cash flow, and is positioned to benefit from substantial global growth opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -8.6%) continues moving lower after delivering its latest round of bad...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -8.6%) continues moving lower after delivering its latest round of bad earnings news (I, II). Nomura's Stuart Jeffrey sees RIM's warning as evidence that demand for its latest phones is already stalling. Eric Jackson sees it as more proof of the "muddled thinking" of co-CEO Jim Balsillie. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +5%) moves up after announcing its Phase 2 interim data from clinical...

    Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +5%) moves up after announcing its Phase 2 interim data from clinical trials, using an intravenous administration of its pancreatic cancer drug Reolysin in combination with other drugs, successfully reached its primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • MTZ

    Infrastructure contractor MasTec (MTZ +4.5%) moves up after saying it's secured an extension of...

    Infrastructure contractor MasTec (MTZ +4.5%) moves up after saying it's secured an extension of its wireless contract work with its single largest customer for an another three years, naming it a primary vendor for its prior markets and a secondary vendor in two new markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +9%) is now rallying strongly following its FQ3 report, closing in on its...

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +9%) is now rallying strongly following its FQ3 report, closing in on its all-time high in the process. While the cosmetics retailer's top-line guidance was lukewarm, it guided for FQ4 same-store sales growth of 6%-8%, which is above Piper's 4% estimate, and management's 3%-5% long-term target. Jefferies is maintaining a Hold, but thinks highly of management's expansion plans. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +15%) jumps in early trading after Collins Stewart initiates...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +15%) jumps in early trading after Collins Stewart initiates the shares with a Buy and a $13 price target. The firm says the drug developer has a couple of solid drugs in the pipeline for 2012, one for acute coronary syndrome and another for lupus, that could become standard care treatments. Additionally, Wedbush ups the shares to Buy on valuation as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BIG

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -8.1%) peeter out after the firm releases Q3 earnings showing...

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -8.1%) peeter out after the firm releases Q3 earnings showing lower-than-expected EPS and moderate same-store sales. The firm warns in an earnings CC that consumer demand will be challenging. "The question we don't know the answer to is which trend will carry forward throughout the Christmas season - the more cautious consumer of early November, or will the robust traffic pattern of Thanksgiving weekend dominate in December?"

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM

  • You can't keep a good "momo" name down. Lululemon ([[LULU +6.4%) has now retraced the entirely...

    You can't keep a good "momo" name down. Lululemon ([[LULU +6.4%) has now retraced the entirely of yesterday morning's near 15% plunge on a revenue miss and weak guidance. Helping today is a trio of upgrades from Barclays, Janney, and Keybanc.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +13.1%) surges higher in the early going after raising its FQ2 sales...

    Western Digital (WDC +13.1%) surges higher in the early going after raising its FQ2 sales outlook and painting a milder view of the impact of Thailand's flooding. Think Equity raises its rating to Buy and hikes its price target to $40 from $25: "WDC appears to be managing the crisis very effectively and hence appears unlikely to lose as much share as we had previously anticipated."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • CBRL

    Shares of Cracker Barrel (NASDAQ:CBRL) gain 4.3% after the firm lands an upgrade from Morgan...

    Shares of Cracker Barrel (NASDAQ:CBRL) gain 4.3% after the firm lands an upgrade from Morgan Keegan to Outperform from Market Perform with a lofty price target of $58. With today's action, CBRL is now on a 19% tear since raising its FQ1 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +12%) is taking off in the wake of its FQ2 guidance hike. However, top...

    Western Digital (WDC +12%) is taking off in the wake of its FQ2 guidance hike. However, top competitor Seagate (STX -1%) is underperforming, as the news leads investors to fear the benefits seen by the latter from the former's Thai troubles may not be as large as expected. Storage giants EMC (EMC +1.5%) and NetApp (NTAP +0.8%) are rising with the market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALEX

    Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX +10.1%) says it plans to split itself into two companies, one with...

    Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX +10.1%) says it plans to split itself into two companies, one with interests in real estate and agriculture with the other in ocean transportation and logistics, in a very weak shipping market. The separation is expected to be completed in the second half of next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR), which owns valuable spectrum assets, is up 7.9% in the wake of Verizon's...

    Clearwire (CLWR), which owns valuable spectrum assets, is up 7.9% in the wake of Verizon's (NYSE:VZ) spectrum purchase, adding to yesterday's gains. The Street appears pleased not just with Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) and Time Warner's (TWC) windfall, but also with the fact they're retreating (for now, anyway) from the wireless space, where they've struggled to compete. Cox recently gave up on its own mobile efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • VZ

    Trying to keep up with the fast-growing demand for bandwidth, Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) agrees...

    Trying to keep up with the fast-growing demand for bandwidth, Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) agrees to buy Spectrum and its 122 wireless licenses from Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) and Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) for $3.6B. Comcast's share of the proceeds will be $2.3B; Time Warner's, $1.1B. (PR) Comcast +2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA) stands to be a big winner from the opening up of the market for...

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA) stands to be a big winner from the opening up of the market for generic versions of Lipitor. In an agreement with India's Ranbaxy Laboratories, TEVA shares profits from the first 6 months of sales by Ranbaxy of its newly-approved cholesterol-lowering drug. Analyst Priti Arora speculates the deal was an insurance policy for Ranbaxy in case it didn't land approval - but is now ending up as "free money" for TEVA. Shares +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM

  • Stock index futures hold onto the morning's big gains thus far following the NFP number. S&P...

    Stock index futures hold onto the morning's big gains thus far following the NFP number. S&P 500 +1.3%, Nasdaq 100 +1.3%. This is one of the more irrelevant releases in years - it's all about Europe right now.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • EEP

    Shares of Enbridge Energy (NYSE:EEP) fall off 4.5% in premarket trading following its...

    Shares of Enbridge Energy (NYSE:EEP) fall off 4.5% in premarket trading following its announcement of a secondary offering of class A common units.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • GES

    Citi takes a harsher view of Guess (NYSE:GES), downgrading shares to Neutral and slashing its...

    Citi takes a harsher view of Guess (NYSE:GES), downgrading shares to Neutral and slashing its price target to $33 from $47. Analysts with the firm say they think there's both a "product and macro" issue at work after its double-digit comparable store sales drop. Shares -1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM

  • Gold moves to new highs on the week and looks set for another assault on $1,800/oz. as the...

    Gold moves to new highs on the week and looks set for another assault on $1,800/oz. as the monetary spigots are opening again, all around the world. A partial list from the last 72 hours: China RRR cut, Fed dollar swap line cut, Brazil rate cut, ECB shenanigans. The metal currently sits at $1,760, +1.1% for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • BB

    Shares of Research In Motion (RIMM) fall 5.4% after resuming trading following the firm's...

    Shares of Research In Motion (RIMM) fall 5.4% after resuming trading following the firm's adjusted earnings forecast (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM | 1 Comment
